What's a big risk that you have taken that has turned out well?
You could be in a dream of an acquaintance, and you'll never know about it.
WRITING.TEXT: I think about the random dreams I have of people that I don't know well, or someone I met once. So naturally, I'd wouldn't tell them about it. If only they knew the weird dreams that I have featuring them. Makes me wonder if I've been in a dream of someone else that barely knows me.
Awesome! I remember coming out to my sister who is Muslim too, and I was so scared. But she was fine! Don't listen to haters who send you stupid PM's, most people will be awesome about everything.

True, i find it a bit misleading. The star rating isn't just a general health rating, it rates it between other items that are similar to it and fall into one of the 6 categories they have set up. So milo will be rated "healthier" than other chocolate flavor mixes like Cadbury or nesquik.
Source: http://healthstarrating.gov.au/internet/healthstarrating/publishing.nsf/Content/frequently-asked-questions-consumers
It was a benign skin lesion. But I'm glad I got it check. But it has scarred now, which is annoying, but better safe than sorry.

I don't know how common those garage door things are, but I had the exact same one when I lived in the apartment building next to St. Peter's station. And also had to put tape on the back of it.

I can give you perspective as a partner who is with someone who is a widow.
My girlfriend had a girlfriend who died 3 years ago (she was 24, died suddenly after being hit by a car). We've been together for about a year and a half. She is always conscious about how I feel about it. Honestly, I love hearing about her late partner. She gets upset now and then when things remind her of her late partner, but I never want her to hold the feelings inside, or feel like she needs to hide her love for her. I've accepted that she will always love her, and that's ok. My partner has PTSD from the accident, so everyday is a challenge, but I will always support her, no matter what.

WRITING.TITLE: Why do some songs have the artist sing their name/the producers name as part of the song at the start? (X-post ELI5)
WRITING.TEXT:
I mainly notice it in the rnb/rap/hip-hop genre but also in pop music. I understand, to an extent, if they're singing out the producers name because most people won't know that, but why their own name? Is there a purpose to this?
Edit: Some examples are Jason Derulo, Lady Gaga, Akon.

WRITING.TITLE: ELI5: Why do some songs have the artist sing their name/the producers name as part of the song at the start?
WRITING.TEXT: I mainly notice it in the rnb/rap/hip-hop genre but also in pop music. I understand, to an extent, if they're singing out the producers name, but why their own name? Is there a purpose to this?

On Fridays, my team at the office goes out to lunch. I usually bring in food from home so I can control what I'm eating, but I make an exception on Friday. I still try order the healthiest thing on the menu, but usually it'll be something a little bit higher in calories than what I'd normally eat. So that's my "cheat" for the week.
I use happy scale to input my weight and see the losses in more detail. And MyFitnessPal, which you already have.

Try putting your details into a tdee (total daily energy expenditure) at https://mytdee.com
It should tell you how many calories to lose weight, to maintain etc and what goal you want (lose fat, gain muscle). This is how I started with my weight loss journey. Worked out what number I needed to eat under to lose weight and used my fitness pal to make sure I stayed under it by logging my food.

Yep, have had two of these, both gifts. Awesome wallets. My one complaint about it is, my first one got wet from water spilling in my bag, and the leather went all weird and discoloured, but would have happened to most leather wallets anyway.
If you think you lost it on the train, you can contact the lost and found. Someone may have handed it in. https://www.sydneytrains.info/contact_us/lost_property

There are some really cool sites that deliver fresh meals (depending where you are). Its really good if you're really really tempted at the supermarket. Do this for a few weeks if you can. Then start learning how to create these meals on your own. Online order your groceries so you're not tempted yet. I only go to the supermarket if I'm desperate and I try and get in an hour. I hate how they have designed the shops so you have to go through heaps of crap food to get a few things.
